title.narrative: REG/FLC Building a Young Constituency for Peace across the South Caucasus and Turkey

description.narrative: Goal of the project is to contribute to peace and stability in the South Caucasus and Turkey by creating an environment of respect among young people and civil society groups across borders. This will be accomplished by 1) Building leadership and civic par ticipation capacities of young people and civil society groups from Georgia (including Abkhazia) Armenia Azerbaijan and Turkey to work in the field of community development at the grassroots level 2) Fostering trust among young people from conflicting side s through the implementation of cross community projects and promotion of cooperation around common agendas 3) Promoting positive perceptions across borders among the broader public by publicizing cross-border youth activities using multiple public outreac h tools. EPF has been implementing the Youth Bank program for more than three years in Georgia Armenia and Azerbaijan as a civic activism and democracy advancement tool for young people at the community level. EPF has recently partnered with a Turkish orga nization to expand the program to a limited number of Turkish communities. Project will support 30 of the existing Youth Banks and establish 9 new Youth Banks in Abkhazia and Turkey through local partners. Project has parallel activities in Georgia (incl uding Abkhazia) Armenia Azerbaijan and Turkey followed by cross-border cooperation and networking activities: 1) Expansion of the Youth Bank Program 2) In-country Networking Workshop and Exhibition 3) Exchange Visits between Youth Banks 4) Community-based Grant-making 5) Networking Meeting in Istanbul
